summary: This is an email chain from May 2019 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) prosecutor and an FBI agent, discussing contact information for a potential victim/witness in the Epstein investigation. The prosecutor provides background on the individual's connection to Epstein and authorizes the FBI to make initial contact.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email, providing contact information and background on a potential witness/victim to an FBI agent. They authorize the FBI to make contact and discuss logistics for an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator who met the potential witness while she was in high school and who is the subject of the investigation.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is investigating Epstein and his associates as part of the SDNY case.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Contact Attempt
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI are attempting to contact a potential victim/witness in California as part of their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is a May 2019 email from a SDNY prosecutor to an FBI agent coordinating the contact of a potential witness/victim.
The potential witness is described as having met Epstein while in high school and being one of his victims, and her name appears in one FBI 302 report.
The prosecutor states the individual has not been interviewed by law enforcement before and was not currently represented by counsel at the time.
The email indicates the witness's name was on a contact list and the best number for her had been identified after 'a lot of back and forth'.
The plan was for the FBI to make initial contact, with a potential in-person meeting in California later in the month.
